subject: Investing
title: Stock Splits Demystified
description: A micro-lesson that makes Stock Splits Demystified usable.

hook.text: Amazon's stock hit $2,785. Then it did a 20-for-1 split and opened at $139. Nothing actually changed.

buildup.text: A stock split divides each share into more shares at a proportionally lower price. Your total value stays the same.

discovery.text: Companies split to make shares more accessible. A $3,000 share intimidates small investors. $150 feels approachable.

twist.text: Fractional shares made splits less necessary. You can buy $50 of any stock regardless of share price now.

climax.text: Berkshire Hathaway never split its A shares. One share costs over $600,000. Buffett sees it as a feature.

punchline.text: A split changes the slice size, not the pizza.

quiz.question: What happens to total investment value after a stock split?
